qas.question: Where would the Byzantine church of the Lazarium be located today?
When was the Byzantine church of the Lazarium constructed?
The mosaic at the Byzantine church of the Lazarium most closely resembles mosaics from which area?
A church was built on top of the Byzantine church of the Lazarium in waht century?

context: An exceptionally well preserved, carpet-like mosaic floor was uncovered in 1949 in <a0_0>Bethany<a0_0/>, the early Byzantine church of the Lazarium which was built <a1_0>between 333 and 390<a1_0/>. Because of its purely geometrical pattern, the church floor is to be grouped with other mosaics of the time in <a2_0>Palestine<a2_0/> and neighboring areas, especially the Constantinian mosaics in the central nave at Bethlehem. A second church was built above the older one during <a3_0>the 6th<a3_0/> century with another more simple geometric mosaic floor.
